network.param.modules.inventory

Interface IInventoryManager

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    InventoryManager

    public interface IInventoryManager
    Perform inventory related operations.

    IInventoryManager add/edit/get/getAll catalogs from the ParamNetwork. Using NetworkManager can able to access this reference.

    ICatalogueManager catalogueManager = networkManager.getInventoryManager();

    Want to perform any bulk upload items to implement this interface IBulkImport interface for remote files, for local files use FileBulkFileImportConfig.

    ICatalogue defines below categories of operations:

    • addInventory method for add java catalogue object into ParamNetwork

    • editInventory method for edit java catalogue object into ParamNetwork

    • getInventory method for get catalogue object from ParamNetwork

    • incrementInventoryQtyByCatalogueID method for getting catalogueIDs from ParamNetwork

    • decrementInventoryQty method for getting catalogueIDs from ParamNetwork

    • decrementInventoryQtyByCatalogueID method for getting catalogueIDs from ParamNetwork

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Jitendra Kumar Balla, ParamNetwork

    • Method Detail

      • addInventory

        void addInventory(IInventory inventory)
           throws NetworkException,
                  ValidationFailedException
        Method will add inventory into param network.

        Method will check all the validations checks are pass, system has active internet access and valid key, it will create IInventory in the ParamNetwork, Otherwise it will throw an exception.

        Parameters:
        inventory - Bean Inventory Object
        Throws:
        NetworkException - Unable to connect to ParamNode it will raise exception.
        ValidationFailedException - Any mandatory files are not set, then this method will throw an ValidationFailedException

      • editInventory

        void editInventory(IInventory inventory)
            throws NetworkException,
                   AccessDeniedException,
                   ValidationFailedException
        Method will update inventory information into param network.

        Method will check all the validations checks are pass, system has active internet access and valid key, it will edit IInventory in the ParamNetwork, Otherwise it will throw an exception.

        Parameters:
        inventory - Bean Catalogue Object
        Throws:
        NetworkException - Unable to connect to ParamNode it will raise exception.
        ValidationFailedException - Any mandatory files are not set, then this method will throw an ValidationFailedException
        AccessDeniedException - Not having enough access rights then it will throw an error

      • getInventory

        IInventory getInventory(java.lang.String catalogID)
                 throws NetworkException,
                        AccessDeniedException,
                        RecordNotExistsException
        Method fetch inventory information for a given catalogID.

        First method will check system has active internet access, requested catalogue is exists and Has access for the resource then, it will return IInventory for a given catalog ID. Otherwise it will throw an exception.

        Parameters:
        catalogID - catalogue id
        Returns:
        Inventory for a given catalogue ID
        Throws:
        AccessDeniedException - Not having enough access rights then it will throw an error
        NetworkException - Unable to connect to ParamNode it will raise exception.
        RecordNotExistsException - If record not exists it will throw an error.

      • getAllInventoryHistories

        java.lang.String[] getAllInventoryHistories(java.lang.String catalogueID)
                                     throws NetworkException,
                                            AccessDeniedException,
                                            RecordNotExistsException
        Method fetch all the inventory ID's for a given catalogue.

        First method will check system has active internet access, requested catalogue is exists and Has access for the resource then, it will return inventory history IDs. Otherwise it will throw an exception.

        Parameters:
        catalogueID - catalog id
        Returns:
        IInventory Object
        Throws:
        NetworkException - Unable to connect to ParamNode it will raise exception.
        RecordNotExistsException - If record not exists it will throw an error.
        AccessDeniedException - Not having enough access rights then it will throw an error
